metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3171 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
sosreport 3.2 uses weak permissions for generated sosreport archives, which allows local users with access to /var/tmp/ to obtain sensitive information by reading the contents of the archive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sosreport - 3.1-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sosreport package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1-1ubuntu2.1').
